ygData.subject: ImportError: No module named ctml_writer, OS X
ygData.msgSnippet: I am running Cantera from Matlab on an OS X 10.5 machine.  Since upgrading to 10.5 Cantera has worked just fine, however I once got frustrated with the X11

Subject: ImportError: No module named ctml_writer, OS X

I am running Cantera from Matlab on an OS X 10.5 machine.  Since  
upgrading to 10.5 Cantera has worked just fine, however I once got  
frustrated with the X11 Simlink interface and rebooted into Windows XP  
on the same machine and manipulated the same Matlab files that I use  
from OS X.  These are all things that have done before without error.   
However, rebooting into OS X and starting Matlab I now get the  
following errors.

I have tried (without uninstalling) reinstalling everything but Matlab  
(python, numarray, Sundials, Cantera).  Running the adiabatic.py demo  
also returns an error (see the end for the error).  I have Python 2.5  
installed and my Library/Python/2.5/site-packages folder is empty??

Please help as I have no idea what to try next, and thank you for your  
time and effort for my cause,
Winston Burbank

*From my original folder with the XML files (still works under XP)

 >> run('/Volumes/DATA/Matlab Work/Cantera_Test_Wolf_Solu/assump.m')
  Traceback (most recent call last):
    File "./.cttmp1196269629.pyw", line 1, in <module>
      from ctml_writer import *
  ImportError: No module named ctml_writer

??? Error using ==> run at 56
Error using ==> run at 69
Error using ==> ThermoPhase.ThermoPhase at 14


************************************************
                 Cantera Error!
************************************************


Procedure: importPhase
Error:   no data for species
_________________________________________________________________________________


* I then thought maybe the XML files where different as I am using the  
stable release of Cantera on XP and the cvs version on OS X.  So I  
copied the folder and trashed the XML files expecting Cantera to  
recreate them, however I get the following error with the XML files  
never being created.

  >> run('/Volumes/DATA/Matlab Work/PHD Thesis/assump.m')
  Traceback (most recent call last):
    File "./.cttmp1196269322.pyw", line 1, in <module>
      from ctml_writer import *
  ImportError: No module named ctml_writer

??? Error using ==> run at 56
Error using ==> run at 69


************************************************
                 Cantera Error!
************************************************


Procedure: get_XML_File
Error:   cannot open ./Basic.xml for reading.Note, this error  
indicates a possible configuration problem.
_________________________________________________________________________________

To make the error even more clear I have run the following from Matlab:

 >> gas= importPhase('gri30.cti');
??? Error using ==> ThermoPhase.ThermoPhase at 14


************************************************
                 Cantera Error!
************************************************


Procedure: importPhase
Error:   no data for species


Error in ==> Solution.Solution at 36
t = ThermoPhase(node);

Error in ==> importPhase at 5
   s = Solution(file);
_________________________________________________________________________________


 >> gas= importPhase('gri30.xml');
??? Error using ==> ThermoPhase.ThermoPhase at 14


************************************************
                 Cantera Error!
************************************************


Procedure: importPhase
Error:   no data for species


Error in ==> Solution.Solution at 36
t = ThermoPhase(node);

Error in ==> importPhase at 5
   s = Solution(file);
_________________________________________________________________________________
